  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(List<BoardCoord> selected, int shelfCol) throws DisconnectedException
      Description copied from interface: GameController
      Makes the player perform a move

      A move is defined as both picking the tiles from the game board and putting them inside your own shelfie at a specific column.

      The order with which tiles are put in the shelfie is represented by the order of the selected list, e.g. if selected is {(5, 5), (7, 8)} then (5, 5) will be the first put inside the shelfie, therefore it will go in the lowest possible free space in the shelfie column.

      This method assumes the client already performed all the necessary checks to make sure the player can make a move and that the move itself is valid; it will therefore kick the player off of the server in case this is not the case.

      Specified by:
      makeMove in interface GameController
      Parameters:
      selected - board coordinates of the tiles to pick, ordered by how they need to be put in the shelfie
      shelfCol - column of the shelfie where the tiles need to be places
      Throws:
      DisconnectedException - if the connection is lost during the call

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String message, String nickReceivingPlayer) throws DisconnectedException
      Description copied from interface: GameController
      Sends a message to the specified recipient

      The recipient can be: - a player's nick, in which case a private message will be sent to him, - UserMessage.EVERYONE_RECIPIENT which will send a message visible to every other player in this game

      Specified by:
      sendMessage in interface GameController
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be sent
      nickReceivingPlayer - the recipient (either a player's nick or UserMessage.EVERYONE_RECIPIENT
      Throws:
      DisconnectedException - if the connection is lost during the call
